DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to represent the unit of measure (UOM) associated with a total dose for treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Agent Administration Total Dose Unit of Measure Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A description of applying, dispensing or tendering a medical product or other agent to a clinical study subject._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.:A symbol or combination of symbols which are given certain arbitrary meanings within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A description of applying, dispensing or tendering a medical product or other agent to a clinical study subject.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering a medical product or other agent.

Property.preferredName: Total Dose Unit of Measure Code
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.:A symbol or combination of symbols which are given certain arbitrary meanings within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/1/10 released DEC per direction of model owner as part of caDSR model cleanup activity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The basic quantity or increment used to describe the strength of a product or amount of product in a package._A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. Its purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of absorbed radiation dose equal to the absorption of one hundredth of joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.

Concepts.definition: A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 9/13/23 Added C67372 per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density defined as a spread rate at which one gram of a substance is spread over the area of one square meter. It is equal to approximately 0.029 4935 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit to express quantity of an agent in grams per body surface area in square meters.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density defined as a spread rate at which one gram of a substance is spread over the area of one square meter. It is equal to approximately 0.029 4935 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit to express quantity of an agent in grams per body surface area in square meters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

Concepts.definition: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A SI derived unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one kilogram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic meter, or the concentration of one milligram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one milliliter, or one gram of a substance per one liter of the mixture. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one milliliter.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one kilogram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic meter, or the concentration of one milligram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one milliliter, or one gram of a substance per one liter of the mixture. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one milliliter.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Milligram per Square Meter per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Milligram per Square Meter per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s) per square meter per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

Concepts.longName: Milligram per Square Meter per Day
Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s) per square meter per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of relative amount of a substance equal to one thousandth of an equivalent weight.

Concepts.definition: A unit of relative amount of a substance equal to one thousandth of an equivalent weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one milligram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters. It is also a unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which mass equal to one milligram occupies the volume one cubic deciliter or 100 cubic centimeters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one hour.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one hour.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Milligram per Square Meter per Week

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Milligram per Square Meter per Week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s)per square meter per period of time equal to seven days.

Concepts.longName: Milligram per Square Meter per Week
Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s) per square meter per period of time equal to seven days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

Concepts.definition: A dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is delivered or administered over the time period of one week. This is also a unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit equal to one-thousandth of an international unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit equal to one-thousandth of an international unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed as a number of arbitrary units of substance per one square meter of a body surface area.

Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed as a number of arbitrary units of substance per one square meter of a body surface area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of micrograms of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of micrograms of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose administration rate unit where the amount of product to be delivered or administered is calculated in micrograms as a function of the subject's weight in kilograms and is delivered or administered over the time period of one week.

Concepts.definition: A dose administration rate unit where the amount of product to be delivered or administered is calculated in micrograms as a function of the subject's weight in kilograms and is delivered or administered over the time period of one week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-8 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-8 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of volume equal to one millionth of a liter or one one thousandth of a milliliter.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume accepted for use with the SI and equal to one millionth of a liter (10E-6 liter).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

Concepts.definition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An arbitrary unit of substance content expressed in international units of biological activity per one kilogram of mass of the system. It is also used as a dose calculation unit expressed in international units of biological activity per one kilogram of body mass.

Concepts.definition: A unit of measure of a quantity of substance per unit mass, expressed as the quantity of substance in International Units, divided by the mass of the substance in kilograms. It is also used as a dose calculation unit expressed in International Units of biological activity per one kilogram of body mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unit of arbitrary substance concentration (biologic activity concentration) defined as the concentration of one international unit per one liter of the system volume.

Concepts.definition: Unit of arbitrary substance concentration (biologic activity concentration) defined as the concentration of one international unit per one liter of the system volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unit of arbitrary substance concentration (biologic activity concentration) defined as the concentration of one international unit per one milligram of substance.

Concepts.definition: A unit of measure of quantity of substance per unit mass, expressed in terms of International Units per milligram. (CDISC)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thin slice of material containing a medicinal agent.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a thin slice of material that contain active and/or inert ingredient(s).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s) per kilogram per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed in milligram(s) per kilogram per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Milligram per twenty four hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one thousandth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed in microgram(s) per kilogram per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed in microgram(s) per kilogram per period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Microgram per Square Meter per Hour

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Microgram per Square Meter per Hour
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dose calculation unit expressed in microgram(s) per square meter per period of time equal to sixty minutes.

Concepts.longName: Microgram per Square Meter per Hour
Concepts.definition: A dose calculation unit expressed in microgram(s) per square meter per period of time equal to sixty minutes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

Concepts.definition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Area under Curve Minute Times Nanomole per Milliliter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Area under Curve Minute Times Nanomole per Milliliter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.: Minutes times nanomoles per milliliter.

Concepts.definition: The area between the x-axis and the curve given by the integrand. It is equal to the definite integral of a function. In the field of pharmacokinetics, the area under the curve (AUC) is the area under the curve in a plot of concentration of a drug in plasma against time. AUC is usually given for the time interval zero to infinity, and other time intervals are indicated.
Minutes times nanomoles per milliliter.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Potency Unit Unified Code for Units of Measure Total Dose Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The basic quantity or increment used to describe the strength of a product or amount of product in a package.:A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science,:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The basic quantity or increment used to describe the strength of a product or amount of product in a package.

Concepts.longName: Unified Code for Units of Measure
Concepts.definition: A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. Its purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 5/2010.
